_header: Saint Cecilia of noble kind I-bore was at Rome
Subjects: saints’ lives; Cecilia, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Cecilia in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Cecile of noble kunne ibore was at romeOur lord crist heo
                    louede wel ar heo fram cradel come…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we our suete lord uor hire holi martirdomTo bringe
                    ous to þulke Ioie þat hire soule to com
BodAsh43.Editions:
Lovewell,  Bertha Ellen,
                        ed.  
             The Life of St. Cecilia from ms. Ashmole 43 and ms. Cotton Tiberius E.
                VII.
Yale Studies in English
         3. Boston, New York, 1898: 72-91.
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Originals and Analogues of some of Chaucer’s Canterbury
                Tales.
Chaucer Society
         2nd ser. 7, 10, 15, 20, 22. London: Trübner, 1872-87: 208-18.

Bod779.First Lines:
seint sisile of nobil in kin bore was at romeoure lord
                    crist ȝhe louid wel er ȝhe fro cradil come…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…now bidde we oure swete lord for here strong marterdombring
                    oure soulus to þe ioyȝe þat here to com

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
Seinte Cecilie of noble kynde I bore ȝe was at romeOure louerd
                    crist ȝe louede wel ar ȝe fram cradel come…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we oure swete louerd for hire martirdomTo bringge
                    vs to þat ioye þat hire soule to com
BodLauMis108.Attributed Title:
Vita & passio Sancte Cecilie virginis & martiris (f.
                        230v)
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 490-6.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Cecil come of noble kynde at Rome borne sho wasWhile sho was
                    ȝonge sho lufed god forþi sho had grete graceSho was cristende
                    priuely als we in story redeAnd faste sho prayed to Ihesu criste to kepe
                    hir madenhede…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Ihesu for þis maiden lufe & for hir
                    martirdomeÞou brynge vs to þat mekil ioye þat hir saule is
                    to come

CamFitzMc128.First Lines:
…The queller hyr smete with all his mayn thre sith in hir
                    fwyreHe ne might it fully smyten of ho boght the deth full
                    der…
CamFitzMc128.Last Lines:
…lord for the martirdome that saint Cecile was InGraunte vs to
                    that ylk Ioye to com that hir life con wynne
CamFitzMc128.Note: Begins imperfectly at line 235; last 20 lines only.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Cecile of noble kyn ybore was at RomeOure lord crist ȝeo
                    louede wel ar ȝeo ffram hure cradel come…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we oure lord ffor hure stronge martirdomTo bringe
                    vs to þulke ioye þat hure soule to com

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint Cecelie of noble kunde bore was at romeOure lord heo loued
                    wel or heo fram cradel com…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…lord for þe marterdom þat seint Cecile wasgraunt
                    ous þulke Ioie þat hire saule ys Inne

BLCottCleoDIX.First Lines:
[S]Eint Cecile of noble kinne ibore was at RomeOur louerd crist
                    ȝeo louede wel er ȝeo fram cradel come…
BLCottCleoDIX.Last Lines:
…Nou louerd for þulc marterdom þat seint Cecilie
                    haddeGraunte ous to þulk ioie come þer þat angles hire to
                    ladde amen
BLCottCleoDIX.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Space left for enlarged
                    ‘S’, which was left blank.
BLCottCleoDIX.Editions:
Lovewell,  Bertha Ellen,
                        ed.  
             The Life of St. Cecilia from ms. Ashmole 43 and ms. Cotton Tiberius E.
                VII.
Yale Studies in English
         3. Boston, New York, 1898: 72-91.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEinte cecile of noble kunne ibore was at romeour lord crist heo loueþe wel ar heo fro cradel come…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …nou bidde we our suete lord for here strong martirdomto bring vs to þilke ioie þat here soule to com
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxxxii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 187); ends, “Amen.”

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEint cecilie of noble kunne ybore was at romeOure louird crist ȝeo louide wel ar ȝeo fram cradel come…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Nou bidde we god of heuene vor hire stronge martirdomTo bringe ous to þulke ioie þat hire soule is to ycom

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt cecylie of noble lynne yore was at RomeOur lord crist heo loued wel ar heo fro cradel come…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Lord for martirdom þat seynte cecylye haddeGraunt vs to þulke ioye come þat þin aungel her ladde

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Cecile of noble kyn born was at RomeOure lord Crist she loved
                    wel er she fro þe cader come…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Lord for þe martirdome þat saynt Cecile was
                    InGraunte vs to þat ioye to come þat hir lyf con wynne
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Cicile þe good mayde ybore was at RomeOur lord she loued
                    moche er she from cradel come…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now prey we our swete lord þat for hur marterdomBrynge
                    vs to þat ilk ioye þat hur soule to come. Amen
